alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Upper Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:25PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Routt, east central Moffat and northeastern Rio Blanco Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 525 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Craig to 9 miles southwest of Hayden to 18 miles west of Oak Creek. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Craig, Hayden and Tow Creek. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 92 and 119. Colorado 13 between mile markers 92 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Upper Yampa River Basin
